text: Lots of people don't like to call it division because it's not unique, and you can get zero for non-zero divisors. But it is *a* inverse to multiplication,  so I don't see what's wrong with it.

elements.text: Lots of people don't like to call it division because it's not unique, and you can get zero for non-zero divisors. But it is
inverse to multiplication,  so I don't see what's wrong with it.

text:
I think programmers are very used to non-canonical answers.

2 mod 3 should be a set of numbers that are 2 mod 3...
